clinical_study.brief_title: Total Hip Arthroplasty (THA) Surgical Techniques Comparing the Direct Anterior Approach to the Posterior Approach
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Single Center Clinical Evaluation of THA Surgical Techniques Comparing the Direct Anterior Approach to the Posterior Approach

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the short term effectiveness and return to function of subjects undergoing primary Total Hip Arthroplasty using an Anterior Approach (incision on the front part of the hip joint) versus Posterior Approach (incision over back part of the hip joint).

primary_outcome.measure: Returning to Quality of Life by using either Anterior Approach versus Posterior Approach
primary_outcome.description: Functional activities (distance walked, assistive devices used) Length of hospital stay/Harris Hip Score Elements/Hip disability and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score/Timed walking tests/Complications/Patient Withdrawal/Revision/Deaths (as applicable) At Two years, we will measure Harris Hip Score,UCLA activity score, and Radiographic evalution score. At 5 years, we will measure Harris Hip Score, UCLA activity score and Radiographic evaluation score. At each time interval we will evaluate expected non-interval change between the Anterior and Posterior approach. The outcome measures at 2 and 5 years have been validated outcome measures for joint replacement surgery for peer reviewed orthopedic literature. Note: The outcome we are measuring at each interval is to return to quality of life as measured by the validated outcome measures noted above. Thus we are measuring one outcome at each interval.

arm_group.description: Total hip arthroplasty performed through an anterior surgical approach. Compare results of total hip arthroplasty performed through either an Anterior or Posterior Surgical Approach

The additional arm is the posterior approach total hip, which the Anterior Approach is being compared too. Compare results of total hip arthroplasty performed through either an Anterior or Posterior Surgical Approach.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject is able to or capable of providing consent to participate in the clinical investigation.
2. Subject is between the ages of 20-75 years, inclusive.
3. Subject requires a cementless, primary total hip arthroplasty for non-inflammatory degenerative joint disease (NIDJD)
4. Subject has sufficient bone stock for the hip replacement device.
5. Subject is a suitable candidate for the devices specified in the clinical investigation plan and is willing to be randomized to either surgical approach.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subject in the opinion of the Investigator has an existing condition that would compromise his /her participation and follow-up in this investigation.
2. Subject has had previous surgery on the affected hip.
3. Subject has significant osteoarthritis of the contra-lateral hip requiring a total hip arthroplasty within 12 months.
